fnsb.macstransit.routematch

Class Stop

  • java.lang.Object
    • fnsb.macstransit.routematch.MarkedObject
      • fnsb.macstransit.routematch.Stop

  • public class Stop
extends MarkedObject
    Created by Spud on 2019-10-18 for the project: MACS Transit.

    For the license, view the file titled LICENSE at the root of the project.

    Since:
    Beta 6.
    Version:
    2.0.

    • Field Detail

      • EMPTY_STOPS_ARRAY

        public static final Stop[] EMPTY_STOPS_ARRAY
        Fallback array used for returning an array of stops that is zero in length. This is commonly used for an early exit scenario when bad arguments are provided, and the method cannot continue otherwise.

      • route

        public final Route route
        This is the route that the stop corresponds to.

      • circle

        public com.google.android.gms.maps.model.Circle circle
        The circle marking the bus stop on the map (be sure to check if this exists first as it may be null).

      • circleOptions

        public final com.google.android.gms.maps.model.CircleOptions circleOptions
        The options that apply to the circle representing the stop. These options include:
        • The coordinates of the stop
        • The current size of the circle
        • The color of the circle
        • Whether the circle is clickable or not

        ... and more!

    • Constructor Detail

      • Stop

        public Stop(String stopName,
            double latitude,
            double longitude,
            Route route)
        Creates a new Stop object using the name, coordinates on the map, and the route.

        Important note: While this sets up the circle options and the name and route, it does not create the actual circle object as that requires the map object to be loaded.

        The circle for the stop is created when its called to be shown on the map.

        Parameters:
        stopName - The name (or ID) of the stop.
        latitude - The latitude position of the stop on the map.
        longitude - The longitude position of the stop on the map.
        route - The route that the stop corresponds to.

      • Stop

        public Stop(@NonNull
            JSONObject json,
            Route route)
     throws JSONException
        Lazy creation of a new Stop object using the provided JSON and the route.
        Parameters:
        json - The JSONObject containing the bus stop data.
        route - The route this newly created Stop object will apply to.
        Throws:
        JSONException - Thrown if there is any issue in parsing the data from the provided JSONObject.

    • Method Detail

      • showStop

        @UiThread
public void showStop(com.google.android.gms.maps.GoogleMap map)
        Shows the stops for the given route. If the stops weren't previously added to the map then this method will also see fit to add them to the map.

        This should be run on the UI thread.

        Parameters:
        map - The google maps object that the stops will be drawn onto. Be sure this object has been initialized first.

      • hideStop

        @UiThread
public void hideStop()
        Hides the objects on the map. This doesn't dispose of the circle object, but rather sets it to invisible (and also sets it to not be clickable in an attempt to disable its hit box from overriding other circles).

        This should be run on the UI thread.

      • generateStops

        @NonNull
public static Stop[] generateStops(JSONArray array,
                                            Route route)
        Creates an array of stops from the provided json array. If the json array is null then the stop array will be 0 in length.
        Parameters:
        array - The json array containing the stop information.
        route - The route these stops belongs to.
        Returns:
        The stop array created from the json array.

      • validateGeneratedStops

        @NonNull
public static Stop[] validateGeneratedStops(Stop[] potentialStops)
        Validates the provided array of potential stops and returned the actual stops in the route, removing any duplicate or invalid stops.
        Parameters:
        potentialStops - The potential stops that may contain duplicate or invalid stops.
        Returns:
        The validated stops array (or an empty stop array if the provided potential stops is null).

      • isDuplicate

        public static boolean isDuplicate(Stop stop,
                                  Stop[] stopArray)
        Checks the provided stop against an array of stops to check if its already contained in the array (and is therefor a would-be duplicate).
        Parameters:
        stop - The Stop object to check for.
        stopArray - The stop array to compare the Stop object against.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the Stop object was found within the array - otherwise it returns false.

      • doStopsMatch

        public static boolean doStopsMatch(Stop stop1,
                                   Stop stop2)
                            throws NullPointerException
        Checks if the two provided stops match (have the same name and location).
        Parameters:
        stop1 - The first stop to compare.
        stop2 - The second stop to compare.
        Returns:
        Whether the first and second stops are the same.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Thrown if stop locations are null.

      • removeStopCircle

        @UiThread
public void removeStopCircle()
        Removes the stop's circle from the map. This also sets the circle to null so it can be recreated later. This must be run on the UI Thread.
